title: Weird Tales

renewed-issues.note: Issue number repeats for May and July issues.

renewed-contributions.title: Those Who Seek
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record says this appeared in the February 1932 issue, but both Galactic Central and ISFDB place it in the January 1932 issue.

renewed-contributions.title: Laughter in the Night
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record only mentions Derleth, but Galactic Central and ISFDB name Schorer as a co-author.

renewed-contributions.title: In the Left Wing
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record only mentions Derleth, but Galactic Central and ISFDB name Schorer as a co-author.

renewed-contributions.title: A Battle Over the Teacups
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record claims this was published in the June 1932 issue of Weird Tales, but Galactic Central and ISFDB do not show it appearing in that issue.  ISFDB does note a Derleth story titled 'A Battle Over the Tea-Cups' in the Summer 1932 issue of Oriental Stories.

renewed-contributions.title: Lair of the Star-Spawn
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record only mentions Derleth, but Galactic Central and ISFDB name Schorer as a co-author.

renewed-contributions.title: Red Hands
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record only mentions Derleth, but Galactic Central and ISFDB name Schorer as a co-author.

renewed-contributions.title: Mr. Jimson Assists
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record claims this was published in the April 1933 issue of Weird Tales, but Galactic Central and ISFDB do not show it appearing in that issue.  They instead place it in the April 1933 issue of Magic Carpet.

renewed-contributions.title: The Man Who Told the Truth
renewed-contributions.note: Story was credited to Kjelgaard in the magazine, but copyright was renewed by Bloch, with CCE record saying Bloch was using Kjelgaard's name as a pseudonym.

renewed-contributions.title: The Isantsa in the Parlor
renewed-contributions.note: Author is August Derleth writing under a pseudonym. Renewal record in CCE gives title as 'The Isantsa in the Parlor'; Galactic Central and ISFDB give title as 'The Tsanta in the Parlor'.  I have not examined the issue to see what title is shown there.

renewed-contributions.title: The Whippoorwills in the Hills

renewed-contributions.title: Notebook Found in a Deserted House
The Night They Crashed the Party
Hell's Bells
renewed-contributions.note: Author name as given on issue cover.  Renewal record gives pseudonymous last name as 'Munroe'.

renewed-contributions.title: Caveat Emptor
renewed-contributions.note: Pratt is credited along with De Camp in FictionMags, but only De Camp is mentioned in the online renewal record for this story. I have not examined the issue in question.

additional-note: This magazine occasionally included reprints (which are often noted in the contents databases we link to here). We have not systematically surveyed the copyright status of stories reprinted in this magazine, but some of them may still have active copyrights.
